definition: too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: But too much of a good thing isn't the only problem with contact management programs today.
sentences.chinese: 过犹不及不仅仅只是目前联系人管理程序的唯一问题。

sentences.english: Don´t remove too much text though or you may achieve the opposite effects instead.
sentences.chinese: 但也别删削太多，或是达到过犹不及的程度。

sentences.english: So-called doable, everything just to need and exist.
sentences.chinese: 所谓过犹不及，一切都只为了需要而存在。

sentences.english: Confucius has said succinctly with a "too far" to be summarized middle ground.
sentences.chinese: 孔子曾简洁地以一句“过犹不及”来概括中庸之道。

sentences.english: All excess is a failing, but above all in personal intercourse.
sentences.chinese: 过犹不及，人际交往最忌失衡。

sentences.english: He argues that democracy can be “too much of a good thing.”
sentences.chinese: 他认为民主可能“过犹不及。”

sentences.english: But like any other good thing, too much of it transforms it to a vice.
sentences.chinese: 但是和其他好事情一样，过犹不及。

sentences.english: Sometimes you need to know how much is too much.
sentences.chinese: 有时候你需要知道过犹不及的道理。

sentences.english: Having made big cuts already, though, there is a risk of overplaying that card.
sentences.chinese: 不过，产量的大幅削减也带来了过犹不及的风险。

sentences.english: Her dress is very elegant, but her hat over-eggs the pudding.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙子非常雅致，但那顶帽子有点过犹不及。

sentences.english: You consider medicating kids with drugs like Ritalin over-parenting.
sentences.chinese: 你认为给孩子服用类似于利他灵的药物是过犹不及么？

sentences.english: However, using the courseware too much is as bad as using it too little…
sentences.chinese: 然而，教学课件应用过频，则会产生过犹不及的效果。

definition: when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
to produce the opposite of the desired result
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/also written 欲速則不達|欲速则不达
